statements.name: PROC CAS
statements.description: Enables you to program and schedule SAS Cloud Analytic Services actions from the SAS client.

statements.name: ACTION
statements.description: Runs SAS Cloud Analytic Services actions.

arguments.name: action-set-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the action set that contains the action to run. Examples are table, simple, and network.

arguments.name: action-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the action to run. Examples are loadTable, listActions, and serverStatus.

arguments.name: parameter
arguments.description: the specified action’s parameters. You can discover the parameters for an action with the help action.

arguments.name: RESULT=
arguments.description: stores the results of the action in a variable. You can then use the variable in other CASL statements and actions. You can use the variable with statements such as DESCRIBE and with a selected set of SAS statements within the scope of the CAS procedure invocation.

arguments.name: STATUS=
arguments.description: stores the status code of the action in a variable. You can examine the status code to determine if an action completed with or without any errors. If you do not specify a variable-name, a variable named _status that contains the status codes is created.

arguments.name: ASYNC=
arguments.description: enables you to submit multiple requests to the server. If your requests are in the same session, the requests are queued in the order received. If your requests are in separate sessions, the requests are executed in parallel.

statements.name: CALL
statements.description: Calls a function with the specified argument. If the function returns a value, it is ignored.

arguments.name: function
arguments.description: the name of the built in or user defined function.

arguments.name: argument
arguments.description: specifies values that are passed to a function when it is called.

statements.name: CONTINUE
statements.description: Stops processing the current DO loop iteration and resumes with the next iteration.

statements.name: DEFAULT
statements.description: Enables you to control how CASL returns action results and action processing status.
statements.help:
Form 1: 
DEFAULT 
            RESULT=variable-expression;
Form 2: 
DEFAULT 
            STATUS=variable-expression;
Form 3: 
DEFAULT 
            CLEAR
            <clear-option-1<clear-option-2< ...clear-option-N>>>

arguments.name: CLEAR
arguments.description: removes the default variable assignment in which an action’s result and status are saved.

arguments.name: RESULT
arguments.description: removes the default variable assignment where the RESULT of an action is saved.

arguments.name: STATUS
arguments.description: removes the default variable assignment where the status of an action is saved.

arguments.name: RESULT=
arguments.description: sets the default variable where results from an action are saved. variable-expression is any expression that results in either a variable or data structure element into which a value can be stored.

arguments.name: STATUS=
arguments.description: sets the default variable where the status of an action is saved. variable-expression is any expression that results in either a variable or data structure element into which a value can be stored.

statements.name: DELETE
statements.description: Deletes the specified value from memory.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: definition of the location for the value that is to be deleted. The value can be a variable, list, array, or a dictionary.

statements.name: DESCRIBE
statements.description: Enables you to view the structure and data type of CASL variables and expressions.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: The name of the variable that you want to view structure and data types for.

arguments.name: expression
arguments.description: A combination of one or more values, constants, variables, operators, and functions that are evaluated using rules and precedence to compute a result.

statements.name: DO
statements.description: Creates a block of code that executes as one statement.

statements.name: DO OVER
statements.description: Iterates over an array, dictionary, or table.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: specifies the variable that is assigned the key value for a dictionary element.

arguments.name: var
arguments.description: specifies the variable that is assigned the value associated with the key for an array or dictionary element.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the array, dictionary, or table.

statements.name: DO UNTIL
statements.description: Executes statements in a DO loop repetitively until a condition is true.

arguments.name: condition
arguments.description: specifies one numeric or character expression evaluation that results in a Boolean result. The result is used to decide to which code path to execute next. The condition is executed at the bottom of the loop. This means that the body of the loop always executes at least once. When the expression evaluate is true, it stops the iteration of the loop.

statements.name: DO WHILE
statements.description: Executes statements in a DO loop repetitively while a condition is true.

arguments.name: condition
arguments.description: specifies one numeric or character expression evaluation that results in a Boolean result. The result is used to decide to which code path to execute next. The condition is evaluated prior to executing the body of the loop. This means the body of the loop may not execute.

statements.name: ELSE
statements.description: If the expression specified by an IF statement results in a false value, the statement immediately after the ELSE statement is executed.

statements.name: END
statements.description: Ends a DO group, FUNCTION, or SELECT group processing.

statements.name: ENDEXTERNALSOURCE
statements.description: Marks the end of the EXTERNALSOURCE statement.

statements.name: ENDSOURCE
statements.description: Marks the end of the SOURCE statement.

statements.name: EXIT
statements.description: Exits the current block of CASL code.

arguments.name: expression
arguments.description: a combination of one or more values, constants, variables, operators, and functions that are evaluated using rules and precedence to compute a result.

statements.name: EXTERNALSOURCE
statements.description: Enables you to embed text in the program as a block of code and then assign the code to a given variable.

arguments.name: variable-expression
arguments.description: specifies the variable to assign the embedded text to, or an expression yielding the variable to which the text is assigned.

arguments.name: ENDEXTERNALSOURCE;
arguments.description: specifies the end of the EXTERNALSOURCE statement.

arguments.name: embedded-text
arguments.description: specifies a string representation of the value.

statements.name: FILE
statements.description: Enables you to specify a different output destination.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: Fileref can be any of the following: • uses the default print location with ODS output when appropriate. • uses the default print location, but does not use ODS. It uses the internal format routines and outputs to the SAS Log when appropriate. • <name> uses the named fileref location for output. • <path> uses the given path as the location for output.

statements.name: FNC
statements.description: Lists all common functions by name and category with simple descriptions.

arguments.name: category-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the category to display functions from. For a list of category names, see .

statements.name: FORMAT
statements.description: Associates a format with a single variable or a list of variables.

statements.name: FUNCTION
statements.description: Creates a new function that can be called in an expression.
statements.help:
FUNCTION  function- name (<parameter–1><, parameter–2><, ..., parameter–n>); 
	statements;END ;

arguments.name: function-
arguments.description: specifies a user-defined function name.

arguments.name: statement
arguments.description: is any series of CASL statement.

arguments.name: parameter
arguments.description: specifies a variable name that holds an argument value passed to the function when it is called.

statements.name: FUNCTIONLIST
statements.description: Lists all CASL built-in functions and user defined functions by name with simple descriptions.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the function to list information about.

statements.name: GLOBAL
statements.description: Creates a variable that can be accessed and used anywhere within a CASL program.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies a variable name.

statements.name: GOTO
statements.description: Transfers execution immediately to a labeled statement.

arguments.name: label
arguments.description: specifies a statement label that identifies the GOTO destination. Statement labels are defined by using the Label statement.

statements.name: IF
statements.description: Conditionally executes a statement based on the value of an expression.

arguments.name: THEN
arguments.description: If the expression results in a true value, the statement immediately after the THEN argument is executed.

arguments.name: condition
arguments.description: determines which statement executes next.

arguments.name: statement
arguments.description: specifies any CASL statement.

statements.name: Label
statements.description: Specifies a label target for the GOTO statement. No semicolon is required.

arguments.name: label
arguments.description: specifies any identifier, which is followed by a colon (:). You must specify the label argument.

arguments.name: statement
arguments.description: specifies any executable statement, including a null statement (;). You must specify the statement argument.

statements.name: LEAVE
statements.description: Stops processing the current loop and resumes with the next statement in the sequence.

statements.name: LOADACTIONSET
statements.description: Loads a SAS Cloud Analytic Services action set.

arguments.name: action-set-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a SAS Cloud Analytic Services action set.

statements.name: LOCAL
statements.description: Creates a variable that is local to a CASL function.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies a variable name.

statements.name: Null
statements.description: A statement that performs no operation.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: Sets the active output location.

arguments.name: ODS
arguments.description: specifies that the output is sent to an ODS destination.

arguments.name: LOG
arguments.description: specifies that the output is sent to the SAS log.

statements.name: PRINT
statements.description: Writes the values of constants, variables, and expressions to the current output location.

arguments.name: TRACE
arguments.description: specifies a trace level message.

arguments.name: DEBUG
arguments.description: specifies a debug level message.

arguments.name: INFO
arguments.description: specifies an info level message.

arguments.name: NOTE
arguments.description: specifies a note level message.

arguments.name: WARN
arguments.description: specifies a warn level message.

arguments.name: ERROR
arguments.description: specifies an error level message.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: can be a constant, variable, or expression.

statements.name: PRINTLST
statements.description: Prints to the listing file defined by the application. If the value is a list, the list will be transverse and each item will be displayed. If the item is a table, it will be printed to the current output location.

arguments.name: expression
arguments.description: A combination of one or more values, constants, variables, operators, and functions that are evaluated using rules and precedence to compute a result.

statements.name: RETURN
statements.description: Returns a value from the current function.

arguments.name: expression
arguments.description: The result of the expression is the value returned by the function to the calling environment (or to the caller).

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies the value that is returned from a function.

statements.name: RUN
statements.description: Executes the previously entered SAS statements.

statements.name: SAVERESULT
statements.description: Saves a result table in the variable in the form specified.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: specifies a variable that includes one or more result tables.

arguments.name: CASLIB=
arguments.description: specifies which caslib to use.

arguments.name: CASOUT=
arguments.description: specifies to transfer the result table to the server and store it as an in-memory table. By default, the active caslib is used but it can be overridden with the CASLIB= argument.

arguments.name: CSV=
arguments.description: specifies the CSV file name. The best practice is to specify a fully qualified path. If you do not specify a fully qualified path, then SAS attempts to create the file in the current working directory for the SAS process.

arguments.name: DATAOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS library and data set name. The default libref is Work.

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: specifies the external file or file reference to use.

arguments.name: "external-file"
arguments.description: specifies the file path. The best practice is to specify a fully qualified path. If you do not specify a fully qualified path, then SAS attempts to create the file in the current working directory for the SAS process.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a SAS file reference.

arguments.name: LIB=
arguments.description: specifies which SAS library to use. The specified libref must be a V9 engine libref.

arguments.name: REPLACE
arguments.description: specifies to overwrite existing files or to prevent overwriting existing files. By default, SAS data sets, external files, and in-memory tables are not overwritten. Specify REPLACE to overwrite existing files.

arguments.name: NOREPLACE
arguments.description: specifies to overwrite existing files or to prevent overwriting existing files. By default, SAS data sets, external files, and in-memory tables are not overwritten. Specify REPLACE to overwrite existing files.

statements.name: SELECT
statements.description: Executes one of several statements or groups of statements.

arguments.name: (select-expression)
arguments.description: specifies an expression that evaluates to a single value.

arguments.name: (when-expression)
arguments.description: specifies any SAS expression, including a compound expression. SELECT requires you to specify at least one when-expression.

arguments.name: statement
arguments.description: specifies any executable SAS statement, including DO, SELECT, and null statements. You must specify the statement argument.

statements.name: SESSION
statements.description: Specifies a session to use for actions invoked by the program.

arguments.name: session-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of an existing session.

statements.name: SET
statements.description: Controls options that modify some behaviors of CAS actions and controls corresponding messages from the SAS log.

arguments.name: DISP
arguments.description: specifies printing the disposition returned from a CAS action in the SAS log.

arguments.name: ECHOEXTSRC
arguments.description: allows the embedded text in the EXTERNALSOURCE statement code block to be echoed to the SAS log.

arguments.name: LOGS
arguments.description: specifies printing messages from CAS in the SAS log. The default value is TRACE.

arguments.name: LOGS=
arguments.description: enables you to specify any one of the following options to control messages to the log:

arguments.name: DEBUG
arguments.description: prints all log messages except those that are displayed using the TRACE option.

arguments.name: NOTE
arguments.description: prints all log messages except those that are displayed using the DEBUG and TRACE options.

arguments.name: TRACE
arguments.description: prints all log messages to the log.

arguments.name: WARN
arguments.description: prints all log messages except those that are displayed using the DEBUG, NOTE, and TRACE options.

arguments.name: USEWIDTH
arguments.description: specifies the use of the defined column width of character string values in a table. Values with widths less than the defined width of the column are padded with blanks to the full defined column width. USEWIDTH affects only fixed-length character variables within a result table. Varying-length character variables are not affected.

arguments.name: WARNINGDUP
arguments.description: specifies printing a warning message in the SAS log when two or more response dictionary entries that are returned from a CAS action have the same key. For the runCasl action, the SEND_RESPONSE function can be used by CASL code to send one or more response dictionaries from the action to the client. When the responses contain duplicate named values, the last value received from the CAS action in a response becomes the value for that key.

statements.name: SOURCE
statements.description: Enables you to embed text in the program and assign it to a given variable.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: The variable to assign the text to.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: specifies a string representation of the value for the variable.

statements.name: UNSET
statements.description: Turns off options that modify some behaviors of CAS actions and suppresses corresponding messages in the SAS log.

arguments.name: DISPOSITION
arguments.description: specifies printing the disposition returned from a CAS action to the SAS log.

arguments.name: ECHOEXTSRC
arguments.description: prevents SAS from echoing the lines gathered by the EXTERNALSOURCE statement to the SAS log.

arguments.name: LOGS
arguments.description: specifies printing messages from CAS to the SAS log.

arguments.name: USEWIDTH
arguments.description: specifies defining the width of string columns in a table based on the maximum width that is used for each character value, instead of basing the width on a globally defined width for all values. USEWIDTH affects only fixed-length character variables within a result table. Varying-length character variables are not affected.

arguments.name: WARNINGDUP
arguments.description: specifies that no warnings for duplicate response dictionary entries are printed.

statements.name: UPLOAD
statements.description: Transfers a file from the SAS client to the server. After data transfer, the server loads the data into an in-memory table.

arguments.name: PATH=
arguments.description: specifies the path to the file to upload. The path must be fully qualified from a directory that the SAS client can access.

arguments.name: CASOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the settings for a basic output table. The following parameters can be specified: • CASLIB= “string” • INDEXVARS={ “variable-name-1” <, “variable-name-2, ” ...>} • LABEL= “string” • NAME= “table-name” • PROMOTE=TRUE | FALSE • REPLACE=TRUE | FALSE • REPLICATION=integer

arguments.name: IMPORTOPTIONS=
arguments.description: specifies the file format and options. The value that you specify for the fileType parameter determines the other parameters that apply. For more information about the fileType parameter, see "importOptions" in the Upload action.
